required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare three glucose measurement techniques among diabetic children and adolescents. The study seeks to determine if a microneedle patch (made from biocompatible polymers or metal), versus a lancet or intravenous catheter, would be a preferable option for monitoring glucose levels among the diabetic pediatric population.

detailed_description.textblock: Fifteen children and adolescents with diabetes will be tested for their glucose measurements comparing interstitial fluid collected via a microneedle patch (made from biocompatible polymers or metal), versus the standard of care blood sample (lancet), and lab grade blood draw (intravenous catheter). Samples will be taken hourly from all three devices for four hours. All four measurements will be compared against each other to see how close they are with measuring the glucose values. Each participant will be asked to rate their apprehension prior to receiving each method for blood or interstitial fluid collection as well as the pain associated with each method immediately after collection.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Microneedles Patch
primary_outcome.description: Interstitial glucose levels will be assessed using a microneedles patch. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via the lancet and intravenous (IV) collection methods.
Glucose levels will be assessed using a lancet. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and intravenous (IV) catheter methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Intravenous Catheter
primary_outcome.description: Glucose levels will be assessed by intravenous (IV) catheter. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and lancet methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Microneedles Patch
primary_outcome.description: Interstitial glucose levels will be assessed using microneedles patch. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via capillary and intravenous (IV) catheter methods.
Glucose levels will be assessed using a lancet. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and intravenous (IV) catheter methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Intravenous Catheter
primary_outcome.description: Glucose levels will be assessed by intravenous (IV) catheter. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and lancet methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Microneedles Patch
primary_outcome.description: Interstitial glucose levels will be assessed using microneedles patch. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via capillary and intravenous (IV) catheter methods.
Glucose levels will be assessed using a lancet. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and intravenous (IV) catheter methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Intravenous Catheter
primary_outcome.description: Glucose levels will be assessed by intravenous (IV) catheter. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and lancet methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Microneedles Patch
primary_outcome.description: Interstitial glucose levels will be assessed using microneedles patch. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via capillary and intravenous (IV) catheter methods.
Glucose levels will be assessed using a lancet. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and intravenous (IV) catheter methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Level assessed by Intravenous Catheter
primary_outcome.description: Glucose levels will be assessed by intravenous (IV) catheter. This measurement will be compared to glucose levels collected via microneedles patch interstitial fluid and lancet methods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Microneedle Apprehension Level assessed by Apprehension Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) to report the level of apprehension they feel regarding this method of sample collection. Participants will mark on a line scale (between not afraid and very afraid) to indicate fear level when a sample is collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Lancet Apprehension Level assessed by Apprehension Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) to report the level of apprehension they feel regarding this method of sample collection. Participants will mark on a line scale (between not afraid and very afraid) to indicate fear level when a sample is collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Intravenous (IV) Apprehension Level assessed by Apprehension Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) to report the level of apprehension they feel regarding this method of sample collection. Participants will mark on a line scale (between not afraid and very afraid) to indicate fear level when a sample is collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Microneedle Pain Level assessed by Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) to report the level of pain they feel regarding this method of sample collection. Participants will mark on a line scale (between no pain and worst pain ever) to indicate pain level when a sample is collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in lancet pain level assessed by pain visual analog scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) to report the level of pain they feel regarding this method of sample collection. Participants will mark on a line scale (between no pain and worst pain ever) to indicate pain level when a sample is collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intravenous (IV) pain level assessed by pain visual analog scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) to report the level of pain they feel regarding this method of sample collection. Participants will mark on a line scale (between no pain and worst pain ever) to indicate pain level when a sample is collected.

arm_group.description: Children and adolescents with diabetes will have blood glucose levels tested using microneedle patches, intravenous (IV) catheter draw, and lancet.

intervention.description: The microneedle patch will collect interstitial fluid to be tested for glucose level. The microneedles are made from biocompatible polymers or metal. Participants will have fasting glucose levels measured four times, on an hourly basis, during the study visit.
The intravenous (IV) catheter will collect venous blood to be tested for glucose level. Participants will have fasting glucose levels measured four times, on an hourly basis, during the study visit.
The lancet will collect capillary blood to be tested for glucose level. Participants will have fasting glucose levels measured four times, on an hourly basis, during the study visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- no exclusion criteria are specified
